doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with Wilfried Thalwitz held on December 12, 1990
doc.abstracts: In December 1990, Wilfried Thalwitz was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by John Lewis, Richard Webb, Devesh Kapur, and Paul Isenman. During his tenure at the Bank from 1963 to 1995, Mr. Thalwitz worked in the following areas; as a young professional (1963-1964); in the projects department as an economist for the transport division (1964-1968); in Indonesia as a senior transport economist (1968-1970); in the western Africa department as division chief (1970-1971); in the transportation projects department as a deputy director (1971-1972); in the western Africa project department as a director (1972-1984); for the West Africa region as a vice president (1984-1987); for the Europe, Middle East and North Africa (EMENA) region as a vice president (1987-1989); in policy, planning and research as a senior vice president (1989-1991); and for Europe and the Soviet Union as a vice president (1991-1995). His transcript concerns his career prior joining the World Bank; his role in Planning Commission and the Reserve Bank of India; former president Barber Conable's and his conscious and deliberate concern with the issue of intellectual leadership; and the debt crisis at the World Bank.
